title: Why is Spear of Shoujin being changed from a way to survive better to a way to do more damage
body:
How many more times to we have to explain this? Bruiser players don't want more damage. We want to actually live through things. We'd really appreciate that more than some gimmick most champs don't use because it either doesn't work or doesn't matter when you get exploded instantly.

Bruisers and Juggernauts don't want more damage. We have enough damage. We want to access it without just building to one shot squishes and pretending to be an assassin

replies.body:
It's a completely new item now, primarily intended for marksmen. The name and artwork of Spear of Shojin got reused since the previous version got scrapped.

Edit: [Here](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/RgwqT7KP-quick-gameplay-thoughts-january-25)'s the original statement:
> The current ER effect (AAs lower CDs after ult cast) gets moved to a new item with an AD, health, CDR statline (using the name and icon of Spear of Shojin, the original design of which we concluded was too overlapped with other items, Sterak’s especially). Goal is to have it be useable by both some marksmen and some other classes as per current ER.

And [this](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/RgwqT7KP-quick-gameplay-thoughts-january-25?comment=00050000) one:
> 
At this point after a lot of testing, yeah, we don't think Shojin's niche was working well enough. Too overlapped with a ranged of other AD+defense (HP or other) items and not particularly bound to light fighters either. Might revisit the space sometime, but no immediate plans, hence repurposing the name and icon for this work instead.

Ah so basically "we can't figure out how to make something that lets fighters be durable in a reasonable way so we're going to forget about it indefinitely and give you another "EPIC DAMAGES" item with a passive component that was already shown to be really obnoxious to deal with and only good on a few specific champs but thats totally fine while giving bruisers and fighters more diverse options to survive isn't"

Oh man can't have defensive items that synergize with other defensive items.

But we can have damage items that synergize with literally every other damage item.

No, it's because it has too much overlap with Steraks.

It creates a situation where you always ask "steraks or shojins?" and the answer is always "whichever has better numbers"

Having an agenda is fine but keep it to yourself.

You know that logic is nonsensical, and even if it weren't, and somehow was sound, the sheer hypocrisy of it invalidates it anyway.  I mean, why have three mana AP items if its always a choice between them, and 90% of the time its made in champion select?  Why have the multitude of zeal items?

Its not like they even shared the same unique, unlike the aforementioned items, and could have been purchased in tandem with actual increases in their individual efficacy, not any dead weight loss as both RIOT and you seem to try to be implying.

Because ultimately the items do different things.

Steraks and Shojin are both just: "bit of damage but mostly anti-burst"

Zeal items:

PD - better 1v1 dueling and chase potential
Hurricane: "AoE" on hits
Shiv: wave clear and minor AoE damage
RFC: Long range first hit

Unless you boil it down to "but they all increase crit" (in which case, every class' items are the same), they do different things.

Steraks and Shojin do the exact same thing in different ways, so it would always be a case of one making the other redundant.

As far as mana items are concerned, everyone agrees that mage itemisation is a total shitshow, so that completely invalidates it being a fair comparison.

I would argue that Sterak's is more for defending against burst, and Shojin is better at dealing with sustained damage.

The reverse to "mostly anti-damage" (edited your wording a little because Shojin isn't that great against burst) when referring to Shojin vs Sterak's is "mostly more damage" in Zeal items.

> [{quoted}](name=DerMangoJoghurt,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=r5q9Pq4m,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-01-26T19:22:36.638+0000)
>
> It's a completely new item now, primarily intended for marksmen.

its not. its still a fighter item. thats why they added health to it.

they reverted {{item:3508}} into a crit item, so they put its current passive on shojin so the fighters that are using essence reaver right now have a replacement.

>primarily intended for marksmen

No
Because riot wants this game to be damage only. Why would they ever give players a way to actually survive in Burst meta lol.

I mean, PD's resistance to shield change is a buff to champs who are below (or cannot steal the difference) up to 2.3k health.

btw, I want to say the PBE change states 280-600 health, anyone know what the shield is scaling with?
Because Essence Flares 6s godmode can't leave Summoners Rift anymore. It's a healthy mechanic!... (/facepalm Rito...)

It's not a bruiser item anymore. 

Decision was that their last design had a bit too much overlap with other items already available to bruisers and juggernauts, particularly Sterak's.
it's even more of a bruiser item now than it was as ER

Mm... maybe I mean it's not *intended* to be a bruiser item anymore, necessarily. Like, that passive certainly works well on many bruisers, but I don't think old ER really qualifies as a bruiser item, either. Neither one gives any health, which I feel is mostly what the OP is asking about. That and health scaling. They are intentionally moving away from that because of the overlap with Steraks/Titanic.

Essence Flare went from being on an item that gave mana to being on an item that gives HP.

If this wasn't intended for Renekton and his buddies, I don't know who it was intended for.

It was intended to nerf them into complete reliance on the item because there's no way a stat efficient Essence Reaver isn't gonna completely break them.

It's gonna be like old Vlad with spell vamp. You have absolutely no choice but to buy the item because you're gonna be useless otherwise.

It's a dumb concept that should have been scrapped entirely and is only gonna create easily foreseeable issues.
PBE Spear is 60 AD, 250 HP, 20% CdR and the Essence Flare passive, relabeled Awakened Dragon.
Because Riot is stupid and doesn't understand we need less damage in the game, and doesn't understand defenses needs to go up. We only been yelling about it for like 2 seasons now.

>We want to actually live through things.

You want items to help live through things? In 2019's League? Now that's a good joke.

Just oneshot the other guy first before he oneshots you and you'll live.

Trust me, you would NOT want to see that item w its old passive in the game on champs like

{{champion:24}} {{champion:23}} {{champion:92}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:114}}  [insert good champ to use it on here]

There is of course the saying of "1v3, 1v4, etc." but w an item like that on one of these guys. that saying will be nothing less but true.

Because completely negating DoTs by buying a single item isn't healthy gameplay.

No juggernaut would have used SoJ. It'd have been Zed, Rengar, Talon, and a bunch of divers picking it up so they can get free defense with their one-shot.
SoJ was only 30% as effective against DoT effects.

Don’t understand why this item got implemented OVER Atmas. 

And this CD passive by using ult was a totally dumb idea. Only a few can use it, but this minority abuses it heavily. 

Remove it from the game before it’s too late (like for Duskblade)

Old spear of Shojin was just as bad. You'd just make fighters nigh unkillable, and they already are hella tanky with their itemisation.
Preferably i'd have neither iterations of it.
Yep I want to OLD Spear of Shoujin not this POS they have now.
what do you mean with '' We have enough damage'' you have WAY too much and thats the problem

OP you might be pleased to hear that some attempts at this are made but aimed at the champions kits here and there.

There is a Vi change incoming where she loses a bit of outright damage on her Q, E and R but gains a little attackspeed later on as well as getting a bigger passive shield and each time she applies her W it reduces her passive cooldown a bit, a buff to help her extended fighting ability that is.

I personally think this is in the perfectly right design for "less burst" but still keeping her as a threat and letting her stay in fights more.

Well i also roll aftershock on her^^
